result.execSummary:
The defendant Martin Aurelio Martinez Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Resulting In Death, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause. 
- No contact with victim's family.

- Cooperate with the department and attend all counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by the department. 
- Absolute sobriety
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor /ammunition and /or explosives. 
- Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

- Provide a DNA sample.
- The Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. 
- Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision. 
- DOC shall collect all sums.
- Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Restitution set at $15,400.27 payable to Crime Victim Compensation Fund.

supervisions.notes: - Operating privileges suspended for a period of 5 YEARS.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martin Aurelio Martinez Rodriguez

records.addlTxt:
HEARING STREAMED LIVE ON DAST.

Defendant Martin Aurelio Martinez Rodriguez in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Martin Aurelio Martinez Rodriguez.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn as interpreter: Hilda Shymanik.

Case in court for sentencing.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  Additional statements by: D.N., M.H., and M.H.

AS TO COUNT 1: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 12 YEARS with 231 days credit; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 8 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and IS NOT the WI Substance Abuse program.


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause. 
- Cooperate with the department and attend all counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by the department.
- No contact with victim's family. 
- Obtain and maintain employment.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Operating privileges suspended for a period of 5 YEARS. 
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

-Restitution set at $15,400.27 payable to Crime Victim Compensation Fund.

The Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given.  Firearms and voting warnings given.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.    Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor/ammunition and/or explosives.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.   Case adjourned for sentencing in Br 45.  Defendant REMANDED.

Defendant Martin Aurelio Martinez Rodriguez in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Martin Aurelio Martinez Rodriguez in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter: Liesl Monroy.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
VIS_D. Harris 22CF170.pdf, Filed.
Plea Forms, Filed.
REST_D. Harris_CVC 22CF170.pdf, Ffiled.

Defendant Martin Aurelio Martinez Rodriguez in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Martin Aurelio Martinez Rodriguez in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared on behalf of Jennifer Tate for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Hilda Shymanik.
Case in court for a plea hearing. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. Based on statements placed on the record by defense, Court determines that the plea negotiations will need to be discussed with the assistance of an interpreter before proceeding with the plea colloquy. Case is passed to address the court calendar.

CASE RECALLED:
Court orders defense to meet with client to go over the plea negotiations and waiver of rights prior to proceeding. Court adjourns matter for a plea/sentencing hearing in Br. 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.

Jury Instructions, filed.
Letter from victim's grandmother, received and filed.
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room 502 SB

Defendands medical appointment issue resolved.  Arguments as to bail.  Court modifies bail:  $25,000 cash with turn over to JPS with Electronic monitoring.  GPS release only for medical appointments.  Status conference June 2, 2022, 8:30 via Zoom.  kmw

Defendant Martin Aurelio Martinez Rodriguez in court with attorney Annette E Rauch.  Defendant Martin Aurelio Martinez Rodriguez in custody. Sworn as interpreter: Fred Svensson. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 34.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
